stimulus:
In this experiment, you will be presented with 8 scenarios, which you must read carefully.

After reading each scenario, you will be prompted two comprehension questions: a multiple choice question and a brief open answer question. You will be required to answer both questions for every scenario, meaning 16 questions in total.

To begin the experiment, hit the space bar.

response.Explanation: they have done everything together and had a similar identity up until this point so she likely wouldn't know that Alice would be annoyed by her haircut
Jane probably knows that Catherine was excited to go back to the gym
Jack doesn't seem aware that his cake was messed up so has no reason to think she wouldn't have liked it
Julia and Margaret just met so Julia most likely doesn't know about Margaret's aversion to dogs/bulldogs, plus describing a puppy as "scary" would likely be interpreted as silly.

Phillip was polite and friendly to Eric plus as the manager of a fashion magazine he must take clothes seriously so Eric has no reason to think that any comments about his clothing would be anything other than sincere.
David has only seen them argue plus it's quite common for siblings to be rude/sarcastic about each other.
Even though Ken hasn't talked to Ana since her break up with James he likely still knows that they're on good terms now from other people.

Elizabeth probably heard/saw via social media or elsewhere that Mary was having a good time on the trip while she was on it and since this is shortly after the trip she probably hasn't yet realised that Mary is bitter/reluctant to talk about the trip yet
